definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: The lesions will "bleach out" and become clean wounds that will heal after a molt.
sentences.chinese: 病變會“漂白了”，成爲清潔傷口癒合後，將蛻皮。

sentences.english: The results showed that the reflectivities varied during the wound healing process.
sentences.chinese: 結果顯示激光照射劑量對傷口組織的反射率影響不大。

sentences.english: A nurse cleaned and bandaged the wound.
sentences.chinese: 護士把傷口清洗包紮好。

sentences.english: SEW】The doctor sewed up the soldier's wound.
sentences.chinese: 醫生縫好那士兵的傷口。

sentences.english: And the site's cheeky bravado rubs salt in the wounds.
sentences.chinese: 並且網站厚顏無恥並自信滿滿地往它們的傷口上撒鹽。

sentences.english: There am a gush of blood as his wound re-opened.
sentences.chinese: 他的傷口重開時血流如注。

sentences.english: Doesn't dimple plastics cut have fine line to drop meeting effect effect?
sentences.chinese: 酒窩整形傷口沒好線就掉了會影響效果嗎？

sentences.english: Direct pressure should be kept on a wound for about twenty minutes.
sentences.chinese: 應該在傷口處施壓20分鐘左右。

sentences.english: eg： The nurse applied the ointment to the wound.
sentences.chinese: 護士把藥膏敷到傷口上。

sentences.english: Once wound could heal slowly, my Bo Hui was recollecting.
sentences.chinese: 曾經的傷口會慢慢地癒合，我卜會甾回憶。

sentences.english: Use a washcloth to clean the area if the wound is dirty.
sentences.chinese: 如果傷口處有點髒，可以用毛巾清洗。

sentences.english: Two wounds made one, then he dies a cruel death.
sentences.chinese: 兩個傷口合成一個，然後他死於殘酷的死亡。

sentences.english: Her throat and lower abdomen were slashed.
sentences.chinese: 咽喉和下腹部各有一道傷口。

sentences.english: The report on thatstrand of hair found in Elena Ortiz's wound margin.
sentences.chinese: 歐琳娜傷口邊緣發現的那根頭髮的檢驗報告。

sentences.english: In addition, wounds and abscesses from fighting may need treatment.
sentences.chinese: 此外，從傷口和膿腫戰鬥需要治療。

definition: (of a surgeon) to perform an operation/(of a patient) to have an operation/to decapitate/to behead/to single out as a point of attack
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
knee/(Internet slang) to kneel down (in admiration)
